pages.text: Parapuzosia is a genus of ammonite from the Late Cretaceous of Africa, Europe and North America. These ammonites are quite large, with many species reaching diameters of more than 1 meter, and the largest species reaching around 2 meters. Its shell was mostly flat with some slightly rounded edges. It had distinct primary and secondary ribbing.
